body: Would you mind trying bindings suggested [here](https://github.com/jwilm/alacritty/issues/360#issuecomment-516360460)?

Based on some quick testing, it looks like Alacritty does not send the correct escapes when multiple modifiers are held down. We have bindings for shift, alt **or** control, but not combinations of those.

In theory, this is all the combinations we should support:
```
                    Code     Modifiers
                  ---------+---------------------------
                     2     | Shift
                     3     | Alt
                     4     | Shift + Alt
                     5     | Control
                     6     | Shift + Control
                     7     | Alt + Control
                     8     | Shift + Alt + Control
                     9     | Meta
                     10    | Meta + Shift
                     11    | Meta + Alt
                     12    | Meta + Alt + Shift
                     13    | Meta + Ctrl
                     14    | Meta + Ctrl + Shift
                     15    | Meta + Ctrl + Alt
                     16    | Meta + Ctrl + Alt + Shift
                  ---------+---------------------------
```

This is not only the case for the arrow keys, but also for everything else which uses that mechanism like PageUp/PageDown and function keys.

Implementing this is trivial, it's just a matter of adding additional key bindings, however I question whether we do want to have all of that in your configuration file. I feel like the key bindings are at a point, where we would benefit from not actually having all of them listed in the default config.
@kchibisov seems to be working for alt Shift+Alt+Arrowkey - just missing the sequences for Shift+Ctrl+Arrowkey
That is working. Thanks. Shall I close this one now?

> That is working. Thanks. Shall I close this one now?

No. It'll be closed when all shortcuts that @chrisduerr mentioned above will be added.

repository.name: micro
repository.description: A modern and intuitive terminal-based text editor

issue.body:
## Description of the problem or steps to reproduce
- start tmux or screen (terminal multiplexers)
- try to select text using shift+arrow
- cursor does not move as long as I hold shift

Workaround:

1) add options to tmux.conf
set -g default-terminal xterm
set-window-option -g xterm-keys on

with those settings, text selection in micro works, but they don't work so great for other applications - htop's display doesn't get updated properly, whether I use urxvt or xterm.

1.5) use a gnome-terminal-based terminal emulator (i tried mate-terminal)

With this, htop still looks a little funky, but at least there are no artifacts when using the search function.

issue.title: Alt+Shift+Backslash (Alt+Vertical Bar) not working properly in Kakoune
issue.body:
I use `Alt+Shift+Backslash` (`Alt+Vertical Bar`) combination in Kakoune and it doesn't work properly in Alacritty. I know there was an issue about escape codes with multiple modifiers so I assume that's the cause of this problem. I also tested it with config set to `/dev/null`.

I discovered that it can be fixed by adding this line to section `key_bindings` in config:
```
- { key: Backslash, mods: Alt|Shift, chars: "\x1b|" }
```

I filed this issue in case somebody has a similar problem. Sorry if this behavior is expected or it's not caused by Alacritty.

OS: `macOS 10.14.1`
Alacritty version: `alacritty 0.3.3 (cc3e4d3)`
